title: Banning Abortion Doesnt Protect Womens Health
description: During its coming term, the Supreme Court will review the constitutionality of a Mississippi anti-abortion law that criminalizes abortions after 15 weeks of pregnancy. Already in Mississippi, only one abortion clinic remains to serve the entire state. This new law, one of the most restrictive anti-abortion measures yet, provides no exemptions in cases of rape or incest. Many see it as the gravest threat to Roe v. Wade ever taken up by the Supreme Court. They are not wrong.

title: Love Was the Main Attraction on Their Sightseeing Adventure
description: On the day Kevin James LaBuz married Molly Elizabeth Corbett, the grooms mother made a toast that flowed like a river  the Susquehanna River, to be exact.

title: A Landlord Says Her Tenants Are Terrorizing Her. She Cant Evict Them.
description: For more than a year, Vanie Mangal, a physician assistant at a Connecticut hospital, called relatives to tell them that their loved ones were dying of Covid-19, watched as patients gasped their final breaths and feared that she herself would get sick.

title: Finance Ministers Meet in Venice to Finalize Global Tax Agreement
description: VENICE  The worlds top economic leaders convened on Friday to hash out crucial details of what would be the largest overhaul of the international tax system in a century, kicking off a three-month race to finish a deal by the end of the year.

title: Citizens, Not the State, Will Enforce New Abortion Law in Texas
description: People across the country may soon be able to sue abortion clinics, doctors and anyone helping a woman get an abortion in Texas, under a new state law that contains a legal innovation with broad implications for the American court system.

title: Summer in the Cities: Chicago
description: As the pandemic ebbs in the United States, many travelers have been favoring outdoor, away-from-it-all getaways. According to the travel planning site TripIt, over Memorial Day weekend, major cities like Washington, D.C., and New York were trending down, while outdoorsy spots like Palm Springs, Calif., were newly popular. Two-thirds of my clients are booking houses, ranch stays and hotels in smaller coastal communities, said Shawna Owen, the owner of Huffman Travel, part of the Virtuoso Network.

title: How Ronan Farrow Spends His Sundays
description: Ronan Farrow, the investigative journalist who most recently took a deep dive into the Britney Spears conservatorship case for The New Yorker with Jia Tolentino, is usually not described as laid-back. But these days he certainly looks it. I think the phrase youre searching for is 90s boy band, Mr. Farrow said about growing out his hair, which is usually groomed to a State Department-ready length. Wasnt the intention, but seems to be the result.

title: The Schlock-Horror Drive-In That Rose From the Grave
description: It was about 2 a.m. on a Sunday when the gross-out horror-comedy Class of Nuke Em High started playing at the Mahoning Drive-In. This was the last screening at TromaDance, an annual showcase of low-budget horror and sex comedies produced by the Queens-based Troma movie studio. Earlier that evening, about 600 cars had piled into the drive-in in Lehighton, Pa., but by 2 a.m., only the die-hards remained. Kevin Schmidt, an extra in the film, was among them.

title: Patricia Marroquin Norby Is Bringing a Native Perspective to the Met
description: Big, bold and by many accounts about time, the Metropolitan Museum of Arts 56-word land-acknowledgment plaque, placed on its Fifth Avenue facade in May, honors the Indigenous peoples past and present (principally the Lenape) whose homeland the institution occupies.

title: Regina King and Bradley Cooper Party for the Moth
description: In-person galas are back. While some benefit parties remain virtual, charities and cultural groups are finding that there is no substitute for the real thing. On June 22, the Moth, a nonprofit devoted to storytelling, held a starry gala at Spring Studios in TriBeCa. The Hollywood-heavy crowd included Regina King and Kemp Powers, who were honored, as well as Bradley Cooper, Keith Lucas and Kenny Lucas. One night later, the Bronx Museum of the Arts marked its 50th year with a party and exhibition by the Harlem-based artist Wardell Milan.

title: Accidental Artists Declare Their Love, One Rubiks Cube at a Time
description: Phil Pollack didnt pretend he knew a lot about art when he took Jenn Loeb on a date to the Whitney Museum in 2017. She wasnt much into art, either. Both remember feeling slightly mystified as they poked through galleries under the museums gridded ceilings.

title: Architect Finds a Sense of Belonging for His Familys Homeland, and for Himself
description: The first time Omar Degan set foot in Mogadishu, in October 2017, he quickly grasped that it bore little resemblance to the picturesque cityscape his parents, Somali refugees who had fled to Europe, described to him growing up.

title: Its Hollywood Barbies Moment (and Shes Bringing Her Friends)
description: For 62 years, Barbie has been the hardest-working woman in the toy aisle, using a dizzying array of outfits and accessories  and, lately, changing body shapes and skin tones  while gliding from one career to the next. Astrophysicist Barbie. Ballerina Barbie. Chicken Farmer Barbie. Firefighter Barbie.

title: All the Recipes Our Food Staff Cooked in June
description: Isnt summer grocery shopping just pure ecstasy? The possibilities are endless: succulent stone fruit and berries as far as the eye can see, all the fresh seafood you could ever want, and vegetables  summer squash, okra, corn  that taste as if they were plucked from the sun-warmed dirt just hours earlier. Last month, the Food staff made the most of summers bounty while keeping the recipes short, sweet and, most importantly, low on heat (with a few exceptions). Here are the best recipes we cooked in June.

title: Did a Cuttlefish Write This?
description: Captive cuttlefish require entertainment when they eat. Dinner and a show  if they cant get live prey, then they need some dancing from a dead shrimp on a stick in their tank.

title: What we know and dont know about the assassination.
description: During an attack in the early hours of Wednesday, a group of assassins fatally shot President Jovenel Mose of Haiti and wounded his wife, Martine Mose, in their private residence on the outskirts of the capital, Port-au-Prince.

title: Inside the Mayors Plan to Help N.Y.C.s Schools Recover
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Pfizer says it will pursue booster shots and a new vaccine, citing the Delta variant.
description: Pfizer and BioNTech announced on Thursday that they were developing a version of the coronavirus vaccine that targets Delta, a highly contagious variant that has spread to nearly 100 countries. The companies expect to begin clinical trials of the vaccine in August.

title: Queens Hustles Back to Life and Hawaiis Proud Surfers: The Week in Narrated Articles
description: This weekend, listen to a collection of narrated articles from around The New York Times, read aloud by the reporters who wrote them.

title: The Assassination of Haitis President
description: Sometime after 1 a.m. on Wednesday, a group of 50 men stormed the Haitian presidential compound.

description: The U.S. economy has been less dynamic in the 21st century, by many measures, than it was in the late 20th century.

title: Political instability was fueling a rise in gang violence even before the president was killed.
description: The assassination of President Jovenel Mose on Wednesday by gunmen who broke into his private residence was a stark reminder of the violence that has plagued Haiti for years and escalated in recent weeks.

title: I.M.F. Board Backs $650 Billion Aid Plan to Help Poor Countries
description: VENICE  The International Monetary Fund took a step on Friday toward easing widening global inequality and helping poor nations get access to vaccines, saying its executive board approved a plan to issue $650 billion worth of reserve funds that countries can use to buy vaccines, finance health care and pay down debt.

title: Investors Seek to Cut Pharma Bro Out of His Company
description: For years, Kevin Mulleady was an ally of Martin Shkreli. He worked for one of the pharmaceutical executives hedge funds and later served as an executive at the company where Mr. Shkreli infamously raised a lifesaving drugs price 5,000 percent.

title: Last Summer Review: Growing Pains
description: The film Last Summer plays like an extended montage advertising the arresting views and clear Mediterranean waters of southern Turkey. Like a migratory fish, the teenage Deniz (Fatih Sahin) is lucky to spend summers on this divine coastline beaching, discoing and bronzing in the seaside town where his family has a cottage. This gauzy coming-of-age movie (on Netflix) is set during the summer of 1997, as Deniz tags along with his cool older sister, Ebru (Aslihan Malbora), while nursing puppy love for her teasing bestie, Asli (Ece Cesmioglu).

title: After 45 Years, a Cop Still Looks After His Favorite (Base) Thief
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Catch up: A top student loan servicer wont renew its contract.
Britains economy grew for the fourth straight month, but more slowly than expected.
description: The British economy grew 0.8 percent in May as more pandemic restrictions were lifted, official data showed, but the pace of growth has slowed and economists warn that returning to prepandemic levels will be harder, especially if consumers react cautiously to rising coronavirus infections.

title: M.L.B. Draft: Marcelo Mayer and Five Other Players to Watch
description: The 2021 Major League Baseball player draft will begin on Sunday in Colorado, the site of this years All-Star Game, and will continue for 20 rounds over three days.

title: Tencent Games uses facial recognition to restrict childrens screen time.
description: The Chinese internet conglomerate Tencent said this week that it would deploy facial recognition technology in its video games in an attempt to close a loophole in restrictions aimed at limiting screen time.

title: Hosting an Airbnb Right Now Is Harder Than You Think
description: Last August, Ben and Elana Vorspan bought a cabin in Big Bear City, Calif., a two-hour drive from their home near Los Angeles, thinking it would make for a nice family getaway and a place they could also rent out.

title: Suns Find the Open Man: Its Usually Devin Booker
description: PHOENIX  Devin Booker grew up in Grand Rapids, Mich., as a devoted Detroit Pistons fan. He keyed on Ben Wallaces energy, Chauncey Billupss steadiness, Rasheed Wallaces tenacity and Tayshaun Princes versatility.

title: Dozens Die as Another Factory Fire Strikes Bangladesh
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  At least 51 people died in a fire on Thursday evening at an industrial building outside the Bangladeshi capital, Dhaka, the latest disaster in a country with a long history of unsafe working conditions in its factories.

title: London Police Officer Pleads Guilty to Murdering Sarah Everard
description: LONDON  A London police officer on Friday pleaded guilty to murdering Sarah Everard, the British woman whose disappearance and killing this year set off a national movement demanding that the authorities do more to address violence against women.

title: Summer Reading Contest Week 5: What Got Your Attention in The Times This Week?
description: Update, July 27: Winners from this week have been announced!

description: Richard Branson is scheduled to fly into suborbital space this Sunday, nine days ahead of a similar journey by a fellow billionaire, Jeff Bezos. These first flights for the space moguls will also launch without liability insurance.

description: JINAN, China  Faced with gradually slackening economic growth and a direct order for action from Chinas cabinet, Chinas central bank said Friday that it was taking steps to help the countrys commercial banks lend more money.

title: Local Recalls, by the Numbers

He had been presented with the Golden Ball, the prize for the outstanding player in the 2014 World Cup, on the field at the Maracana, and he had accepted it, because it was the decent thing to do.

description: In 1990, Allan Reiver stared at the trash-filled lot across the street from his apartment and had a vision.

description: A small propeller plane crashed Thursday evening in Sweden soon after taking off from an airport in Orebro, west of Stockholm, killing the nine people onboard  eight sky divers and the pilot.

description: Last September, the writer-director Mike White checked into a recently reopened but still deserted Four Seasons on Maui. He was the first guest since March. The staff gave him a standing ovation.

title: The Kid Laroi and Justin Biebers Bouncy Plea, and 14 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Biden Will End Detention for Most Pregnant and Postpartum Undocumented Immigrants
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration is easing restrictions placed on undocumented people who are pregnant, postpartum or nursing, the latest change in its broader efforts to soften immigration detention policies put in place by former President Donald J. Trump.

title: The Sea of Marmara, a Sapphire of Turkey, Is Choking From Pollution
description: BANDIRMA, Turkey  The Sea of Marmara, fabled for centuries for its blue waters and sparkling fish, laps the shores of Istanbul. Its perfect form inspired a 19th-century historian to describe the ancient city as a diamond set between two sapphires.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. I think it may be a good weekend for making paella, outside on a grill if you can, trusting in the magical properties of rice, stock, heat and time to bring a new measure of joy into your life. Naturally I have a recipe (above) for you, but you may want to range around and consider other preparations, other techniques, before you cook.

description: Dead mussels and clams coated rocks in the Pacific Northwest, their shells gaping open as if theyd been boiled. Sea stars were baked to death. Sockeye salmon swam sluggishly in an overheated Washington river, prompting wildlife officials to truck them to cooler areas.

description: An original work of fiction by Andrew Martin.

description: Athletes are not the only ones who need coaches. All top chess players have them too. They are often experts at particular elements of the game, or openings, that a player feels he or she needs to work on.

title: The Education Dept. will wipe out $55 million in student loans for borrowers at 3 institutions.

description: The International Monetary Funds executive board approved a plan to issue $650 billion worth of reserve funds to help troubled countries buy vaccines, finance health care and pay down debt. If approved by the I.M.F.s board of governors, as is expected, the reserves could become available by the end of August.

title: Nostalgia, Inc.
Garland Settles In but Trump Era Still Shadows the Justice Dept.
description: WASHINGTON  When Attorney General Merrick B. Garland had to decide whether the Justice Department should continue its highly unusual defense of former President Donald J. Trump in a defamation lawsuit, he relied on the studious approach that had served him as a federal judge for more than two decades.

description: In seeking to protect workers and consumers from what his administration views as the harmful consequences of corporate consolidation, President Biden is enlisting support from regulators across the executive branch in what the White House has described as an overarching, whole-of-government effort.

description: It was still pitch black when Nadia Hamila, then a young schoolgirl, would roll out of her warm bed at 3 a.m. to accompany her father to the abattoir in northern London on the first morning of Eid al-Adha.

title: Chief Guantnamo Prosecutor Retiring Before Sept. 11 Trial Begins
description: WASHINGTON  The Army general who has led war crimes prosecutions at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, for a decade is retiring and handing off the trial of the five men accused of conspiring in the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001 to an as-yet unchosen successor.

title: Turning to Ovid in a Moment of Transition
description: OVIDS METAMORPHOSES  has served as inspiration for visual artists for hundreds of years, and in 2020 it felt as relevant as ever. It was the first book that I read as I hunkered down in my apartment at the height of the pandemic. Ovids cast of human and bestial characters are at the mercy of capricious Gods who constantly change themselves and everything around them into different forms.  These transformations are both beautiful and ghastly, violent and serene  a blurring of boundaries between humans, nature and forces more powerful than ourselves. What inspired me most about the Metamorphoses (I read David Raeburns classic translation) is how vibrant and visual these stories are, and how Ovid captures human desperation and fragility.  In making these images I wanted to reflect on the idea of becoming something else. Ovids physical and emotional landscapes are constantly shifting. I wanted to visualize the feelings we are going through as we start to transform back into our normal lives, re-engaging with ourselves and with nature.

title: The Irresistible Drama of Becoming Who You Want to Be
description: Hirokazu Kore-edas latest film, his first set outside of Japan, showcases the great directors signature theme.

title: A Group of Scientists Presses a Case Against the Lab Leak Theory of Covid
description: In the latest volley of the debate over the origins of the coronavirus, a group of scientists this week presented a review of scientific findings that they argue shows a natural spillover from animal to human is a far more likely cause of the pandemic than a laboratory incident.

title: In another blow to Didi, China halts downloads of 25 more of its apps.

description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban forces on Friday penetrated Kandahar, Afghanistans second-largest city, in a new phase of a sweeping insurgent offensive that has captured territory across the country since May 1, when U.S. forces began withdrawing.

title: F.D.A. Seeks Investigation of Its Own Alzheimers Drug Approval
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday called for a federal investigation of the process that led to the approval of a new drug for Alzheimers disease that has spurred sharp criticism from lawmakers and the medical community.

title: We have a lot of work to do. Schumer warns Democrats to expect a busy July.
description: Late nights. Weekend votes. Maybe even the cancellation of part of Congresss prized August recess. The Senates top leader warned Democrats on Friday to expect an arduous sprint when the chamber returns to session next week to try to push forward much of President Bidens ambitious economic agenda in two hulking bills.

title: Summers Must-Make Chilled Soup
description: Hello, friends, and happy cooking. Im filling in for Emily this week and feeling excited about being in the kitchen again after trying Naz Deravians abdoogh khiar, a chilled buttermilk-yogurt soup with cucumbers, walnuts, raisins and herbs. Its fun to have something new for dinner, especially when it requires so little work (and no stovetop time).

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Eve Ewing
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Eve Ewing. Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Italy Holds Its Breath as Its National Soccer Team Prepares to Face England
description: FLORENCE  Italys match against England in the Euro 2021 finals was a couple of days in the future, but on Friday fans of the team were visiting its past at the national football hall of fame in Florence.

title: Review: Unforgotten Makes the Case for Decency
description: During four seasons on ITV, the British police drama Unforgotten has slowly and quietly built an audience and a reputation, an appropriate method for a show in which the main characters rarely raise their voices and are immediately ashamed of themselves when they do. (The shows six-episode fourth season begins on Sunday on PBSs Masterpiece.)

title: Dancing Despite the Rain

title: Tyson Fury tested positive for the virus, putting the future of a heavyweight title fight in flux.
description: Tyson Fury and several other members of his team have tested positive for the coronavirus, forcing his heavyweight title fight with his rival Deontay Wilder to be postponed, a person familiar with the situation said Friday.

title: The Lives of Flies
description: The subtitle of Jonathan Balcombes new book, Super Fly: The Unexpected Lives of the Worlds Most Successful Insects leads to the first question on this weeks podcast. Why successful?

title: This Moths Name Is a Slur. Scientists Wont Use It Anymore.
description: On Wednesday, the Entomological Society of America announced it was removing gypsy moth and gypsy ant as recognized common names for two insects. For Ethel Brooks, a Romani scholar, the move is long overdue.

title: Wonking Out: mRNA and the Meaning of Life
description: Happy days are here again. No, really. Gallup has been asking Americans since the beginning of 2008 whether they are thriving. The percentage answering yes hit a low point in the depths of the 2008 financial crisis and again during the worst of the Covid-19 pandemic. But it has soared in recent months, to 59.2 percent, its highest level ever:

title: Heat-Related Deaths Increase as Temperatures Rise in the West
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Western states braced for another extreme spike in temperatures this weekend after a recent heat wave in Oregon and Washington State killed nearly 200 people and endangered laborers in fields and warehouses.

title: Oath Keepers Leader Sits for F.B.I. Questioning Against Legal Advice

title: Chiellini, Bonucci and the Art of Defending

Some of them are so far-fetched that, if it were not for the eyewitness testimony or the video footage, the natural instinct would be to assume they are apocryphal. The best of them, though, the most illustrative, is the one about the garlic tablets.

title: A Packed Schedule Doesnt Really Enrich Your Child
description: When the extracurricular-industrial complex came to a grinding halt last spring, parents were left scrambling to fill vast hours of unscheduled time. Some activities moved to remote instruction but most were canceled, and keeping children engaged became the bane of parents existence. Understandably, screens became default child care for younger kids and social lifelines for older ones.

title: Haiti Is in Peril, and There Are No Simple Options
description: For years, the United States has adopted a wary tolerance of Haiti, batting aside the horror of kidnappings, murders and gang warfare. The more convenient strategy generally seemed to be backing whichever government was in power and supplying endless amounts of foreign aid.

title: The People We Leave Behind in Afghanistan

The Taliban know that i was cooperating with you people, so if its possible to talk with your respected organization to take me to USA.

description: LAS VEGAS  In the buildup to Conor McGregors last fight with Dustin Poirier in January, McGregor deviated from the brash, trash-talking bravado that had propelled him to the peak of stardom in the Ultimate Fighting Championship.

title: Officials Kill Grizzly Bear Suspected in Fatal Attack of Woman in Montana

title: Biden Calls for Putin to Act on Ransomware Attacks
description: President Biden urged President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia to act when ransomware attacks originate in his country and said the U.S. reserves the right to respond against hackers who launch attacks from Russia.

title: Educators, Tell Us Your Pandemic-Recovery Plans
description: If you are a K-12 teacher or counselor, or are otherwise employed in U.S. schools, we want to hear your thoughts about the year ahead, as you and your students return to the classroom (or dont). title: Hidden Costs and Flawed Training Plague the V.A.s Huge Software Upgrade
description: The Department of Veterans Affairs is in the process of overhauling the countrys oldest electronic health record system at the countrys largest hospital network. Even if it goes smoothly, planners have repeatedly warned, it will be an extremely complicated task that will take 10 years and cost more than $16 billion.

title: White House Says U.S. Law Enforcement Will Be Sent to Haiti
description: The White House press secretary, Jen Psaki, said the Biden administration would respond to the Haitian governments request and send U.S. law enforcement officials to assist after the assassination of President Jovenel Mose.

title: How Instagram Collabs Help Far-flung Bakers Create Together
description: Katherine Walton, the owner of Walton Cake Boutique in Sydney, Australia, has been sharing her creations on Instagram since 2018 but in the early months of the pandemic she noticed a new baking movement rising online  a surge in a specific type of online baking collaboration called collabs.

title: Man Is Accused of Attempting to Sell Fake Basquiats and Harings
description: Angel Pereda, 49, of Mexico, was taken into custody in New York and charged with wire fraud after prosecutors accused him of trying to sell artworks that he falsely claimed had been created by Jean-Michel Basquiat and Keith Haring, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York announced on Friday.

title: Nana Nkwetis Tales of Cameroonians at Home and in America
description: WALKING ON COWRIE SHELLS Stories By Nana Nkweti

title: Russia, Haiti, Wimbledon: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: N.Y.C. Halts Plan to Move Homeless People From Hotels After Legal Filing
description: New York Citys effort to move more than 8,000 homeless people from pandemic hotels to barrackslike group shelters ground to a halt on Friday morning, after the Legal Aid Society filed a motion accusing the city of violating the rights of people with respiratory conditions and other medical and psychological problems.

title: 5 Songs to Listen to Right Now
description: Here are five new and notable songs, including J. Balvins team-up with Skrillex and an expansive ballad by H.E.R. that grapples with infidelity.

title: Colombia confirms that 13 of its former soldiers are among the assassination suspects.
description: A clearer picture of the group that Haiti accuses of assassinating President Jovenel Mose has emerged as officials in the Colombian defense ministry identified 13 suspects by name and said that all were former members of the Colombian military.

title: Blast in Tehran Near State Broadcasting Headquarters Rattles Iran
description: A loud blast rocked northern Tehran near the headquarters of the state broadcasting company in the early hours of Saturday morning, according to security authorities speaking to official state media.

title: Indigenous Women Assume and Cede Prominent Positions in Canada
description: It was an exceptional week of news for Indigenous women, starting with the appointment of Mary Simon, an Inuk from northern Quebec, as Canadas first Indigenous governor general.

title: What Is Critical Race Theory?
description: We had a shorter holiday week on The Daily, but we covered a lot of ground, traveling from Afghanistan to Haiti. Along the way, many of you wrote in to share your thoughts and feelings about our episode on critical race theory.

title: President Biden fired the head of the Social Security Administration.
description: President Biden on Friday fired the man President Donald J. Trump appointed to lead the Social Security Administration, triggering a legal showdown over who rightfully holds the position.

title: Colombian Police Chief Gives Update on Haiti Assassination Suspects
description: Colombian authorities confirmed that its citizens, suspected of participating in the assassination of Haitis president, traveled to the country in two groups by way of the Dominican Republic.

title: Why the New York Subway Has a Water Problem
description: When fast-moving storms flooded parts of New York Citys vast subway system on Thursday, they stranded some rush-hour commuters and underscored just how vulnerable the citys underground transportation lifeline is to water.

title: Another top editor of the publisher of Deadspin and The Onion steps down.
description: The editorial director for the company that owns Deadspin, The Root, The Onion and Gizmodo resigned on Friday, the second time in two years that the publishers top editor had stepped down.

title: What to Do This Weekend
description: Welcome. I received a note this week from a reader that made me reconsider how Im re-engaging with the world. Rachel Albetski of New York City wrote that shes loved meeting up with friends in bars and restaurants. But she was surprised to find that the most joy shes experienced of late has come from walking around alone: I had been so busy catching up with people, she wrote, that I hadnt taken any time to just be solo in New York again!

title: Review: Serving Murder in The Dumb Waiter
description: Have you ever gotten stuck in a dingy basement without even a cup of tea to quench your thirst? Service these days just isnt what it used to be.

title: Haiti Calls U.S. for Troops, After Wild Day of Gunfights and Suspicion
description: After 24 hours of wild gun battles with suspects in the assassination of Haitis president, the nations authorities announced the arrests of 20 people and called on the United States to send troops to help protect crucial infrastructure.

title: At the All-Star Game, a Dimmer Stage for Black Players
description: With his bat, his glove and his flair, Dave Parker put himself in the pantheon of All-Star Game performers. He won the first Home Run Derby, in 1985 in Minnesota, six years after his throwing arm earned him the All-Star most valuable player award in Seattle. That was in 1979, when his Pittsburgh Pirates won the World Series.

title: Charlottesville Removes Robert E. Lee Statue at Center of White Nationalist Rally
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  Four years after a woman was killed and dozens were injured when white nationalists protested the planned removal of a statue of Robert E. Lee in Charlottesville, Va., workers removed the statue on Saturday, along with a nearby monument to Stonewall Jackson, another Confederate general.

title: Texas Democrats Weigh Options for Blocking Voting Bill, Including Flight
description: As Texas Republicans prepare to force votes next week on far-reaching legislation that would introduce new restrictions on voting, Democrats are left facing a gnawing question: Should they fight or flee?

title: What Parents Need to Know About the C.D.C.s Covid School Guidelines
description: With less than a month to go before many schools begin reopening for the fall, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Friday released new guidelines for preventing Covid-19 transmission in schools.

title: Science Doesnt Support Idea That Marijuana Aids Athletes Performance
description: When ShaCarri Richardson was barred from the Olympics this month after testing positive for marijuana, it ignited an ongoing conversation about whether the drug should be classified as performance-enhancing for athletes. Does getting high really improve strength, speed, agility or other outcomes?

title: Biden Fires Trump Appointee as Head of Social Security Administration
description: President Biden fired President Donald J. Trumps appointed head of the Social Security Administration on Friday, setting off a possible legal showdown over who rightfully holds the position.

title: Biden Administration Punts on Due Process Rights for Guantnamo Detainees
description: WASHINGTON  The Biden administration pulled back on Friday from a Trump-era claim that detainees at the Guantnamo Bay wartime prison have no due process rights under the Constitution. But it stopped short of declaring that noncitizens held at the American naval base in Cuba are covered by such legal protections, according to officials familiar with the matter.

title: Investigating a Building Collapse by Studying Clues From One Still Standing
description: SURFSIDE, Fla.  Pavers around the Champlain Towers North swimming pool have been yanked up and drywall removed from a few condo hallways and closets.

title: Haunani-Kay Trask, Champion of Native Rights in Hawaii, Dies at 71
description: Haunani-Kay Trask, a scholar, poet and champion of sovereignty for the Hawaiian people who decried what she called the colonization and despoliation of her native land, died on July 3 in Honolulu. She was 71.

title: Biden Warns Putin to Act Against Ransomware Groups, or U.S. Will Strike Back
description: President Biden warned President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Friday that time was running out for him to rein in the ransomware groups striking the United States, telegraphing that this could be Mr. Putins final chance to take action on Russias harboring of cybercriminals before the United States moved to dismantle the threat.

title: Passive-Aggressive Tactic
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Is it Christmas in July? Trenton Charlson has come down the chimney with his 30th puzzle for The New York Times, and Caitlin Lovinger is taking a well-deserved weekend off, so my stocking is overflowing. I have the distinct privilege of bashing my brain repeatedly against Mr. Charlsons devilish clues and then writing about the experience.

title: Quotation of the Day: M-u-r-r-a-y-a Earns 14-Year-Old $50,000 and a Place in History
description: Its like asking a millipede how they walk with all those legs.

title: Corrections: July 10, 2021
description: An article on Friday about Pope Franciss surgery misstated Franciss age when he became pope. He was 76, not 78.

title: At Wimbledon, Mens Final Takes a Back Seat to England vs. Italy
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Elizabeth Wright, a lawyer from Stratford-upon-Avon, was enjoying her fourth day at Wimbledon on Friday as she watched the first mens semifinal on a large screen. A strawberry floated in her glass of prosecco.

title: The Suns Have Gone Old School at Center. Its Working.
description: There is a clash of styles at the center position in the N.B.A. finals between the Phoenix Suns and the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Road Rage, Zipper Merging and a Stress-Free Path Through Traffic
description: Youre approaching a construction zone and a sign tells you the left lane will end several miles ahead. Traffic is heavy, but you see an opening and move to the right lane. As you inch along, drivers to your left keep zipping by. Miles ahead, you finally reach the merge point and the left-lane drivers make their move. Your pulse quickens. You pull up tight on the car in front of you and refuse to let anyone in. Are you in the right, or are you fortunate that nothing escalated?

title: Would You Get a Pandemic Tattoo?
description: Every day during lockdown Samantha Barry, the editor of Glamour Magazine, walked or ran along the West Side Highway in New York City. I would go from Chelsea to the Statue of Liberty, she said. This was my moment of sanity every day.

title: Is It Art? You May Have to Ask a Neanderthal Critic.
description: In 2019, a team of archaeologists climbed a steep, rocky hill in central Germany and burrowed inside the collapsed entrance of the Unicorn Cave, named as such because people in the Middle Ages once scoured it for unicorn bones. Today it is famous for its animal fossils.

title: Are We in the Metaverse Yet?
description: The biggest ideas in tech often lurch into the lexicon before they are truly coherent. Jargon appears out of nowhere, underexplained and overused: the internet of things, the sharing economy, the cloud.

title: To Kill a Swan? Dispute Over a Birds Fate Ends With a Twist.
description: When Friday began, Alfie the swan was on an avian version of death row. By the time evening came, it seemed he had won a reprieve  though not through the efforts of the people who were trying to save him or the government agencies they had pleaded with for help.

title: When a No-Pet Policy Isnt Really a No-Pet Policy
description: Q: I used to love my rent-stabilized apartment, where Ive lived for a decade, until building management relaxed its strict no-pet policy. I have severe allergies and prefer not to live with other peoples pets. Suddenly, everyone has a dog. Despite my complaints about barking and dog hair trapped in the laundry machines, management insists that the building is not pet friendly. At this point, Id like to move, but I just signed another two-year lease. Can I break my lease over the weakened pet policy?

title: Falling for Coutures Gravitational Pull
description: PARIS  The Cannes Film Festival is in starlet red-carpet swing; the billionaires are back in Sun Valley; and in Paris  Its like a school reunion, no? said Carine Roitfeld, the French fashion editor, flicking her veil of hair from her black-lined eyes and glancing around the Dior show on Monday as the first live couture week in more than a year began.

title: Britney Spearss Case Calls Attention to Wider Questions on Guardianship
description: For nearly 13 years, Ryan King was under a guardianship not unlike the legal conservatorship that controls Britney Spearss life and finances.

title: Who Paid for That Mansion? A Senator or the Haitian People?
description: MONTREAL  He is one of the few lawmakers left in Haiti, a close ally of the assassinated president who has kept his seat while the countrys democratic institutions have been whittled away.

title: Could Gen Z Free the World From Email?
description: Despite the reasonable qualms of older generations, Generation Z  generally defined as people born between 1997 and 2012  is pioneering the return of chaotic trends like low-rise jeans, pop-punk and Ed Hardy.

title: In New Hampshire, a Low-Key Democrat May Face a High-Profile Fight
description: MEREDITH, N.H.  At the Twin Barns Brewing Co., perched near the shoreline of Lake Winnipesaukee, Senator Maggie Hassan sampled some of the signature product on a recent afternoon, then chased it with a promise to fight for more reliable internet service, which the owners said they needed to maintain their customer base.

title: Eric Adams Has Plans for New York, Beyond Public Safety
description: In the afterglow of winning the Democratic nomination for mayor of New York City, Eric Adams began to set out his mission if elected in November.

title: Mother, When Will You Come?: The Covid Orphans of India
description: PATTAPUR, India  In a small, colorfully painted house on Indias eastern coast, G. Sonali Reddy cooks meals and feeds her younger siblings by day and rocks them to sleep at night, hoping to assuage their fears, just as her mother would.

title: Does Free College Work?
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in the news. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: China Plans Security Checks for Tech Companies Listing Overseas
description: China moved on Saturday toward requiring domestic tech companies to submit to a cybersecurity checkup before they can go public on overseas stock exchanges, a step that would close the regulatory gap that allowed the ride-hailing giant Didi to list shares on Wall Street last week without getting a clean bill of digital health from Beijing.

title: Jehan Sadat, 87, Widow of Egypts President and Womens Advocate, Dies
description: CAIRO  Jehan Sadat, the widow of former President Anwar el-Sadat of Egypt, whom she pushed to enact a series of measures aimed at improving womens rights, died on Friday in Cairo. She was 87.

title: In Sri Lanka, the Government Looks Increasingly Like a Family Firm
description: The first attempt by a Rajapaksa to return to power in Sri Lanka was brief.

title: The Ascension of Bernie Sanders
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  I want to talk to Bernie about Balenciaga. And Britney. And Dua Lipa, ShaCarri Richardson and Joe Manchins houseboat. And whether he prefers red or white horseradish on his gefilte fish. And the state of capitalism, and the absurd price of a Birkin bag.

title: Haitian officials called for U.S. military assistance. Some Haitians say, No, No & No.
description: Intellectuals and members of Haitis civil society quickly criticized a call by Haitian officials for the United States to send in troops, citing earlier interventions by foreign powers and international organizations that further destabilized Haiti and left a trail of abuses.

title: Quick and Easy Grilling
description: Gas up the grill! Ali Slagles guide to fast, delicious grilling produced some of the most popular recipes on New York Times Cooking this week. Whether you make her spicy citrus skirt steak (above), spiced grilled halloumi or chicken with parsley-olive sauce, youre sure to end up with a flavorful dinner that doesnt require a lengthy marinade. Or try something else from our collection of quick and easy grilling recipes. For a dessert and cocktail in one, follow up your meal with Vaughn Vreelands salted margarita bars.

title: The Big Question of the 2022 Midterms: How Will the Suburbs Swing?
description: PAPILLION, Neb.  Pursuing a bipartisan infrastructure deal and trumpeting a revived economy and progress against the pandemic, President Biden is trying to persuade the nation that Democrats are the party that gets things done. His message is aimed at holding on to a set of voters in next years midterms who could determine the fate of his agenda: suburbanites who abandoned former President Donald Trump in droves.

title: When a Preacher Doesnt Credit His Sources
description: To the Editor:

title: Theres a Specific Kind of Joy Weve Been Missing
description: In late June, over 15,000 vaccinated people packed in to watch the Foo Fighters reopen Madison Square Garden. When the band brought the comedian Dave Chappelle onstage to sing the Radiohead song Creep, the audience erupted in the closest thing Ive seen to rapture in a solid year and a half.

title: Sorry, We Arent Going Back to the Movies
description: I love Vin Diesel so much that he is the only man who could persuade me to head back to the movie theater post-Covid.

title: How the White Press Wrote Off Black America
description: Newspapers that championed white supremacy throughout the pre-civil rights South paved the way for lynching by declaring African Americans nonpersons. They embraced the language once used at slave auctions by denying Black citizens the courtesy titles Mr. and Mrs. and referring to them in news stories as the negro, the negress or the nigger.

title: Ashleigh Barty Wins Wimbledon Womens Singles Title
description: Ashleigh Barty won her first Wimbledon singles title Saturday, beating Karolina Pliskova, 6-3, 6-7(4), 6-3.

title: What Western Society Can Learn From Indigenous Communities
description: Nearly two decades ago, when the New Zealand highway authority was planning the Waikato Expressway, people from the Mori tribe Ngti Naho objected. The highway would encroach on an area that, in Mori tradition, was governed by a water-dwelling creature, a taniwha.

title: Global Tax Overhaul Gains Steam as G20 Backs New Levies
description: VENICE  Global leaders on Saturday agreed to move ahead with what would be the most significant overhaul of the international tax system in decades, with finance ministers from the worlds 20 largest economies backing a proposal that would crack down on tax havens and impose new levies on large, profitable multinational companies.

title: Heat Wave Spread Fire That Erased Canadian Town
description: TORONTO  Something strange was happening to the acacia trees in Lytton, British Columbia.

title: Variety: Puns and Anagrams
description: This Sunday, Im picking up the Variety column for the first time, filling in for Caitlin Lovinger. I was a little apprehensive about unzipping the advance file of puzzles, not knowing what I would find. Inside, was a brand of brainteaser that I had not solved before: a PandA, or Puns and Anagrams puzzle. PandAs, where have you been all my life?

title: Privacy Is Still a Victim When Rape Cases Hit the Justice System
description: Things were supposed to be different this time, Brooke thought in disbelief as the police officer demanded that she hand over every scrap of data on her phone to investigators  not because she was suspected of a crime, but because she was the victim of one. Years earlier, a man who Brooke had until then considered a friend pulled her into a London alley, pushed her against a wall, choked her and violently sexually assaulted her. Her fear and humiliation, more than just the invasion of her body, seemed to be his goal. Several times, she said, she broke free, only to have him catch her, throw her back against the wall, and assault her again.

title: After Years as a Battleground, Investment Boom Lifts Iraqi City
description: RAMADI, Iraq  On the banks of the Euphrates River, the iron beams and bricks are going up for a 20-story luxury hotel with swimming pools, a spa, and restaurants jutting out into the blue-green waters at the edge of the Iraqi city of Ramadi.

title: On This German Farm, Cows Are in Charge. Or at Least Coequals.
description: BUTJADINGEN, Germany  Tom will lay his head in the lap of anyone who sits down to rub his neck, while Tilda prefers just to nuzzle her young son. Cuddles arent really Chayas thing, but if shes in the mood, shell play pugnaciously with a bale of hay as if its a giant ball.

title: Cannes Film Festival: The Director of Showgirls Takes On Lesbian Nuns
description: CANNES, France  Forgive them, Father, for they have sinned. Repeatedly! Creatively! And wait until you hear what they did with that Virgin Mary statuette.

title: Haitis Power Vacuum Escalates Kingmakers Battle for Control
description: The assassination of Haitis president has thrown the nation into disarray, spawned shootouts on the streets and left terrified citizens cowering in their homes. But behind the scenes a bigger, high-stakes battle for control of the country is already accelerating.

title: Why a Patriotic Education Can Be Valuable
description: I have my doubts about America. As a Catholic, my first loyalty is to a faith that predates and promises to outlast our Republic, that was disfavored for much of our history and may be headed into disfavor once again. American anti-Catholicism is far from the worst evil in this nations history, but it still instills a special obligation to take critiques of our Anglo-liberal-Protestant inheritance seriously, whether they come from radicals or traditionalists or both.

title: The Eclectic Lives BehindAlice Neels Portraits
description: My introduction to the painter Alice Neel was a screen print that hung on the living room wall of my grandparents home in Woodstock, N.Y.  a provocative portrait of Neels pouting granddaughter lounging on a striped chair. That portrait then moved within my family, to Minneapolis, San Francisco and, finally, to my apartment on the Upper West Side of Manhattan  down the street from where Neel painted and lived  where it now hangs on my wall.

title: Death Valley Hits 130 Degrees as Heat Wave Sweeps the West
description: FURNACE CREEK, Calif.  For Gary Bryant, the tenth-of-a-mile walk from his modular home to the air-conditioned restaurant where he was working on Saturday was quite enough time outside.

title: Biden Administration Shows Little Appetite for Haitis Troop Request
description: WASHINGTON  Haitis request for U.S. troops to help stabilize the country following the assassination of its president presents a difficult choice for President Biden: send forces to aid a neighbor even as he is trying to pare down Americas military footprint overseas, or refrain and risk allowing the chaos unfolding there to escalate into a refugee crisis.

title: With Wimbledon Win, Ashleigh Barty Continues Mentors Work
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Long before Ashleigh Barty became a Wimbledon champion, Evonne Goolagong Cawley believed Barty could be a Wimbledon champion.

title: Hiring, Firing, Setting the Culture: Black Women at the Top of TV News
description: Ava Thompson Greenwell, the author of Ladies Leading: The Black Women Who Control Television News

title: Texas Man Who Waited Hours to Vote Is Arrested on Charges of Illegal Voting
description: A 62-year-old Texas man who waited hours to cast a ballot in last years presidential primary was arrested this week on charges that he had voted illegally.

title: Egypt Denies Times Report That Officials Sexually Abused Women
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian government has denied a report by The New York Times that women who encounter the countrys justice system risk sexual abuse during searches by state authorities.

title: Certain Bridge Positions
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  In his puzzle this week, Ashish Vengsarkar leaps across decades of pop culture tropes, playing crack-the-whip with solvers. Shamelessly, he drags us along hand-in-hand behind him down the chutes and up the ladders of dad joke territory, enticing us onward through a thicket of puns by dropping occasional amuse-gueules of ethnic food at strategic points on our route.

title: In Wimbledon Loss, Karolina Pliskova Sees a Silver Lining
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Karolina Pliskova was happy with how she had played in the Wimbledon final on Saturday, despite a disastrous start  she lost the first 14 points of the match  and the fact that it ended in a 6-3, 6-7 (4), 6-3 loss to Ashleigh Barty.

title: Heres how to watch and stream the fight.
description: U.F.C. 264 takes place Saturday night at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. The early preliminary fights start at 6 p.m. Eastern, and the main pay-per-view card will begin at 10 p.m. McGregor and Poirier most likely will not fight until around midnight.

title: Thomas Cleary, Prolific Translator of Eastern Texts, Dies at 72
description: Thomas Cleary, who translated scores of Buddhist, Taoist, ancient Chinese and other texts into English, greatly broadening access to these works in the West, died on June 20 in Oakland, Calif. He was 72.

title: Athan Theoharis, Chronicler of F.B.I. Abuses, Dies at 84
description: Athan Theoharis, a pre-eminent historian of the F.B.I. whose indefatigable research into the agencys formerly unobtainable files produced revelations about decades of civil liberties abuses under the leadership of J. Edgar Hoover, died on July 3 at his home in Syracuse, N.Y. He was 84.

title: Donald Trump will attend the fight, Dana White said.
description: The third fight between Conor McGregor and Dustin Poirier is expected to be one of the biggest sporting events of the year, and perhaps just as alluring as the fight itself is the spectacle of celebrities expected to be in attendance to watch two of the Ultimate Fighting Championships biggest stars face off.

title: After Walkout, Texas Voting Showdown Part II Looms
description: AUSTIN  The issues and arguments were familiar, but the road ahead revolved around a more novel question as nearly 100 witnesses lined a Capitol hallway awaiting the start of an 8 a.m. committee hearing on voting rights in Texas: Do Democrats have a second act?

title: Lionel Messi and Argentina Beat Brazil in Copa Amrica Final
description: Lionel Messi finally ticked the last empty box in his glittering soccer career on Saturday night, leading Argentina past host Brazil, 1-0, in the final of the Copa Amrica in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Max Griffin closed the preliminary bouts with a win over Carlos Condit.
description: In possibly the biggest fight of his career, the welterweight Max Griffin beat Carlos Condit via unanimous decision with a dominant first round in which he landed a series of clean leg kicks.

title: More Prep, More Readers: When Journalists Go on the Air
description: What do you think?

title: Sean OMalley hit Kris Moutinho with flurries upon flurries.
description: An exciting first bout of the U.F.C. 264 main card ended with fan favorite Sean OMalley getting a technical knockout over Kris Moutinho in Las Vegas.

title: Quotation of the Day: Mother, When Will You Come?
description: My mother kept us safe like an umbrella does, from the heat and rain of life.

title: Corrections: July 11, 2021
description: An article last Sunday about masks as a signifier of social class misspelled the surname of a public relations strategist who was recently shopping in Hudson Yards. He is Mark Pasetsky, not Pasektsky.

title: Irene Aldana got a statement win.
description: Amanda Nunes reigns atop the U.F.C. womens bantamweight division, and it is unlikely that she will release that grip anytime soon based on her recent performances.

title: Tai Tuivasa knocked out Greg Hardy then pounded beers.
description: For just a few seconds Greg Hardy had an advantage. Sensing blood in the water, he advanced on Tai Tuivasa. But he did not sense Tuivasas left fist, and just over a minute into the first round it dropped Hardy to the canvas, and the fight was over.

title: Nigeria Wins Historic Upset Over Team U.S.A. in Olympic Exhibition
description: The U.S. mens basketball team was upset by Nigeria on Saturday evening in its first exhibition game ahead of the Tokyo Olympics, a stunning outcome even if the effects are more symbolic than likely to affect the United States eventual gold medal hopes.

title: The Bucks Have Big-Time Supporters: Kareem and Oscar Robertson
description: The Milwaukee Bucks only title came in 1971, when they swept the Baltimore Bullets.

title: Conor McGregor appeared to break a bone at the end of Round 1.
description: Conor McGregor lost his rematch against Dustin Poirier after a bizarre end to the first round in which McGregor appeared to break either his lower left leg or his ankle. As McGregor and Poirier swung at each other, McGregor stumbled backward and broke a bone without Poirier hitting him.

title: The intensity and awkwardness leaves a window for Poirier and McGregor to fight again.
description: Conor McGregor said he would walk Dustin Poirier around the octagon like a dog. Instead, he laid next to the cage with a cadre of medics attending to him while the referee, Herb Dean, raised Poiriers left hand in victory.

title: Two Are Killed in Arizona Firefighting Plane Crash
description: Two people who were helping to fight a wildfire in western Arizona died on Saturday when their plane crashed, the Bureau of Land Management said.

title: I Came Across a Guy Who Was Sitting on the Curb With a Guitar
description: Dear Diary:

title: Soccer Success Is Making England Whole Again
description: LONDON  Lee Anderson will not be watching the match. He has not seen so much as a minute of Englands progress through this summers European soccer championship. He missed the drab, underwhelming early games, the thrilling, cathartic victory against Germany, the smooth dismissal of Ukraine and the gripping, tortuous defeat of Denmark.

title: How Did Allison Highwolf Die? Distrust Fuels a Mystery in Indian Country.
description: NORTHERN CHEYENNE RESERVATION, Mont.  The knock on the door came at 3 a.m., when Pauline Highwolf opened it to see a police officer from the Bureau of Indian Affairs. Dont tell me, she said, backing away.

title: No Rockets, but Anxiety Persists in Southern Israel
description: The 11-day war between Israel and Hamas ended in May, but for Israelis living and working within range of Gaza, the fear of attack is ever present. We spoke with four people affected by rockets and mortars about their decisions to stay on or leave.

title: The Alternating Identities of Shirley Jackson
description: THE LETTERS OF SHIRLEY JACKSON Edited by Laurence Jackson Hyman in consultation with Bernice M. Murphy

title: Homes That Sold for Around $800,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Lord, Hear Me: Residents in Florida Condos Fear They Could be Next
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla.  The condo complex at the exclusive address of Bal Harbour 101 in South Florida feels more like a luxury hotel than somebodys home. At the entrance, residents are greeted by a marble fountain and a valet. Inside is a private restaurant. The balconies upstairs offer panoramic ocean views.

title: Katie Kitamura and the Cognitive Dissonance of Being Alive Right Now
description: Not long after her father died, Katie Kitamura remembers hearing Charles Taylor speak.

title: You Just Feel Like Nothing: California to Pay Sterilization Victims
description: Leonard Bisel was 15 when the state of California decided that he should not have children, threatening to lock him up and force him to do hard labor if he did not submit to sterilization.

title: A Covid Test as Easy as Breathing
description: In May, musicians from dozens of countries descended on Rotterdam, the Netherlands, for the Eurovision Song Contest. Over the course of the competition, the performers  clad in sequined dresses, ornate crowns or, in one case, an enormous pair of angel wings  belted and battled it out for their chance at the title.

title: Haiti, G20, Euro 2020: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Q&A: Siya Kolisi on Rugby, Race and Whats Next for South Africa
description: South Africas national rugby union team, the Springboks, won the World Cup back on Nov. 2, 2019.

title: A message said to be from the presidents widow is posted to Twitter.
description: An audio recording said to be of Martine Mose, the widow of President Jovenel Mose of Haiti, has urged people to carry on his battle in a country long plagued by gang violence and now plunged into a deep institutional crisis.

title: Janet Yellen Warns That Coronavirus Variants Threaten Global Recovery
description: VENICE  Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen said on Sunday that she was concerned that coronavirus variants could derail the global economic recovery and called for an urgent push to deploy vaccines more rapidly around the world.

title: In the Big Euro 2020 Game, I Knew the England I Was Rooting For
description: BERLIN It is an odd thing, to watch your country of birth from afar. Having been in Germany for seven years, I sometimes feel the connection to England with an even greater intensity than I did when I was living there. I find myself being more passionate about its politics  and, of course, its football.

title: From The Sunday Read Archives: Alone at Sea
description: For Aleksander Doba, pitting himself against the wide-open sea  storms, sunstroke, monotony, hunger and loneliness  was a way to feel alive in old age. Today, listen to the story of a man who paddled toward the existential crisis that is life and crossed the Atlantic alone in a kayak. Three times.

title: Why Do English Soccer Fans Sing Sweet Caroline?
description: After a tough year for London  and a tough 55 years for fans of Englands mens soccer team  the citys Wembley Stadium is roaring again, and the fans are singing an American song.

title: With Conor McGregor Injured, U.F.C. Faces Big Challenges
description: LAS VEGAS  As Conor McGregor waited inside the octagon for Dustin Poirier to enter, he bounced around, looking fluid, fresh and agile.

title: What is Virgin Galactics space plane, and what did it do?
description: The rocket plane, a type called SpaceShipTwo, is about the size of an executive jet. In addition to the two pilots, there can be up to four people in the cabin. The particular SpaceShipTwo that flew on Sunday is named V.S.S. Unity.

title: Why did Richard Branson take this risk?
description: Founding a space exploration company was perhaps an unsurprising step for Mr. Branson, who has made a career  and a fortune estimated at $6 billion  building flashy upstart businesses that he promotes with a showmans flair.

title: Branson and the crew received astronaut wings after their successful trip to space.
description: Richard Branson finally got his trip to space on Sunday.

title: Who were the crew members aboard the flight?
description: The pilots are David Mackay and Michael Masucci.

title: In a 100-Mile Race That Demands Both Physical and Mental Fortitude, Women Set the Pace
description: Beth Pascall did not know what was happening behind her.

title: A number of breath-based coronavirus tests are in development around the world.
description: Scientists have long been interested in creating portable devices that can quickly and painlessly screen a person for disease simply by taking a whiff of their breath. But delivering on this dream has proved to be a challenge. Different diseases may cause similar breath changes. Diet can affect the chemicals someone exhales, as can smoking and alcohol consumption, potentially complicating disease detection.

title: New Zealand, where Covid-19 is dormant, fights another respiratory virus, and other news from around the world.
description: Strict lockdowns in New Zealand last year appear to have contributed to a recent outbreak in children of respiratory syncytial virus, or R.S.V., a highly contagious, flulike illness whose symptoms include a runny nose, coughing, sneezing and fever.

title: Short on vaccines, Asia grapples with Delta-driven outbreaks.
description: In recent days, Indonesia has reported nearly twice as many coronavirus cases as the United States. Malaysias per capita caseload is roughly on par with those of Brazil and Iran. And the latest Covid surges in Japan and South Korea have prompted harsh new restrictions on movement there, effective Monday.

title: Can Marijuana Make You a Better Athlete?
description: Josiah Hesse, a journalist who lives in Colorado, never voluntarily exercised a day in his life until he turned 30, when he decided to start doing it for health reasons. But right away, he hated working out.

title: The leader of Haitis Senate is among those vying for power.
description: Just days after the assassination of President Jovenel Mose of Haiti, a high-stakes battle for control of the country is heating up, and the president of the Senate, Joseph Lambert, is among those jockeying for power.

title: Barkevious Mingo, N.F.L. Veteran, Charged With Child Sex Crime
description: Barkevious Mingo, an eight-year N.F.L. veteran, was arrested in Arlington, Texas, on Thursday night and charged with indecency involving sexual contact with a minor, a felony.

title: Will home-field advantage be the difference (again) today?
description: As fans filled the streets outside Wembley again on Sunday ahead of the Euro 2020 final, it is worth remembering that it was not by chance that all four semifinalists  England, Italy, Spain and Denmark  played all three of their group games at home, reducing the amount of time and energy they might have lost to travel over the course of the monthlong championship.

title: Euro 2020s top scorer is the own goal.
description: The battle for the Golden Boot, awarded to the tournaments top scorer, will be decided today, and the England forwards Harry Kane (four goals) and Raheem Sterling (three) seem to be the only two players left with a realistic chance to catch the current leaders, Patrick Schick and Cristiano Ronaldo, who both scored five before departing Euro 2020.

title: Behind Zaila Avant-gardes Win, a History of Struggle for Black Spellers
description: In 1936, MacNolia Cox, a 13-year-old girl from Akron, Ohio, made it to the final round of the National Spelling Bee.

title: For Freelancers, Taking Time Off for a Baby Is Risky
description: Good morning.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Itd be nice to steer into the worlds of tiny houses, #vanlife and trail cooking. But Id want a lot of cooking equipment, too, which complicates matters: a smoker and a 60-inch grill, say, along with a propane hob cooker; a discada; a 110-quart cooler filled with pellet ice. Id want shovels for clambakes, a rotisserie, a Schwenker and absolutely a wood-burning pizza oven on a trailer to haul behind the van or the house, depending. So this remains a pipe dream.

title: Far from Europe, another cathartic victory.
description: England vs. Italy is not the only major final this weekend.

title: Medical Miracles: When Patients Defy the Odds
description: To the Editor:

title: How Local Guerrilla Fighters Routed Ethiopias Powerful Army
description: SAMRE, Ethiopia  The Tigrayan fighters whooped, whistled and pointed excitedly to a puff of smoke in the sky, where an Ethiopian military cargo plane trundling over the village minutes earlier had been struck by a missile.

title: Delayed consequences: Hungary is ordered to play in empty stadiums as punishment for its fans behavior.
description: UEFA ordered Hungary, which hosted some of the biggest crowds of the Euros in Budapest, to play its next three home matches behind closed doors as punishment for the discriminatory behaviour of its supporters during the tournament. The organization also fined the Hungarian soccer federation 100,000 euros ($118,000).

title: After Marathon Hearings, Texas Republicans Advance Voting Measure
description: AUSTIN, Texas  Texas Republicans moved legislation to overhaul the states voting system closer to passage on Sunday, brushing aside fierce opposition from Democrats to gain approval from key committees in the House and the Senate after marathon weekend hearings.

title: Stephen Colbert added a dash of comedy as Branson and crew headed toward space.
description: In this billionaire space race, slipping the surly bonds of Earth apparently isnt enough  not without some glitz and a bevy of celebrities.

title: Iranians, desperate for Covid vaccines, are crossing into Armenia to get them.
description: Thousands of Iranians frustrated with the governments chaotic vaccine rollout and desperate for protection after enduring wave after wave of the coronavirus are flocking by air and land to neighboring Armenia to be vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Pope Francis Leads Sunday Prayer a Week After Surgery
description: ROME  Pope Francis on Sunday made his first public appearance since undergoing colon surgery last week, greeting the faithful from a balcony at Gemelli hospital in Rome.

title: When is Jeff Bezos flight, and how is it different?
description: On July 20, another billionaire is scheduled to take another rocket to the edge of space. Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, founded his rocket company, Blue Origin, with a vision of millions of people living and working in space in the future.

title: Novak Djokovic Wins Wimbledon, and His 20th Career Grand Slam Title
description: Novak Djokovic won the Wimbledon mens singles championship on Sunday, defeating Matteo Berrettini of Italy.

title: I Cant See Myself Doing Anything Else
description: KERMAN, Calif.  Simranjit Singh is a second-generation American farmer, but his agricultural roots go back 900 years.

title: More Power Lines or Rooftop Solar Panels: The Fight Over Energys Future
description: The nation is facing once in a generation choices about how energy ought to be delivered to homes, businesses and electric cars  decisions that could shape the course of climate change and determine how the United States copes with wildfires, heat waves and other extreme weather linked to global warming.

title: Black Widow Star David Harbour Loves Being a Big-Screen Loser
description: This article contains spoilers for the films Black Widow and No Sudden Move.

title: Italy thinks its coming home, too.
description: Every year is a big soccer year in Italy. When the national league finishes, victorious fans parade through city streets in their cars and mopeds. But it is during the international competitions that the Italian soccer fanaticism takes on a semblance of religious faith.

title: The teams have arrived, so find a TV. Heres how to watch England-Italy.
description: Sundays final at Londons Wembley Stadium is being broadcast in the United States by ESPN and Univision, and via their ESPN+ and TUDN streaming platforms. But, of course, many Times readers are not in the United States.

title: Branson Completes Virgin Galactic Flight, Aiming to Open Up Space Tourism
description: SPACEPORT AMERICA, N.M.  Soaring more than 50 miles into the hot, glaringly bright skies above New Mexico, Richard Branson at last fulfilled a dream that took decades to realize: He can now call himself an astronaut.

title: Fauci says boosters are not recommended right now.
description: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci made the rounds of the morning TV news shows on Sunday, trying to quell confusion over the latest federal pandemic guidance for the start of school in the fall as well as growing questions about the necessity of booster shots.

title: What do we really know about Harry Kane?
description: There are a lot of things that everybody knows about Harry Kane. There is the fact that he is the captain of Englands national soccer team, a status that bestows upon its bearer the sort of profile unavailable to most athletes, particularly in tournament years. It is part-of-the-furniture fame, royal family fame. Everyone has heard of Harry Kane.

title: Italys backbone: dependable, inseparable and, at Euro 2020, unbeatable.
description: Italys run to the final of Euro 2020 has, in many ways, highlighted a drastic shift in the countrys soccer culture. Roberto Mancinis team is young, vibrant and adventurous, designed around a slick and technical midfield and imbued with a bright, attacking style.

title: Women Who Shaped Modern Photography
description: Sometime in the 1930s, the Hungarian photographer Anna Barna shot Onlooker, a picture of a boy standing on a chair seen from behind as he peers over a palisade.

title: Richard Branson Launches Into Space on Virgin Galactic Flight
description: The 70-year-old British billionaire and crew members of Virgin Galactic launched the commercial space plane Unity from New Mexico, reached the edge of space and landed safely back at the spaceport on Sunday.

title: A Black American Designer Disrupts the French Couture
description: Villa Lewaro, the Palladian estate built in Irvington, N.Y., by Madam C.J. Walker, a child of slaves who became a beauty mogul and the first female self-made millionaire in the United States, is pretty far, geographically speaking, from Paris  about 3,605 miles.

title: What will it cost to fly Virgin Galactic to space?
description: Not long after Richard Branson re-entered Earths atmosphere on Sunday, he and other employees of his Virgin Galactic venture boasted that the company would greatly expand opportunities for the general public to travel to space. For the moment, those otherworldly views and feelings of weightlessness will still be held in rarefied air.

title: Overwhelmed by Chinese Fleets, Filipino Fishermen Protest and Adapt
description: MASINLOC, the Philippines  The fishermen along the western coast of Luzon Island, in the Philippines, have known for generations that the seas, the tides and the weather can determine their fortunes. More recently, they have added China to that list.

title: Review: A Better Day Dawns With Pam Tanowitzs Witty New Dance
description: RED HOOK, N.Y.  For a moment or two, Pam Tanowitz may have been regretting the title of her latest dance: I was waiting for the echo of a better day.

title: Henry Parham, Who Fought in a Black Unit on D-Day, Dies at 99
description: The story of D-Day, the Allied invasion of Normandy on June 6, 1944, has been told and retold through books, movies and the recollections of soldiers, sailors and airmen.

title: One Village Quelled the Virus. The Next Was Overrun. Its a Bad Sign for India.
description: GARH MUKTESHWAR, India  When a devastating second wave of Covid-19 infections reached Indias countryside this spring, the village of Khilwai took immediate action. Two testing centers were set up, and 30 positive cases were isolated. The outbreak was contained with just three deaths.

title: We Dont Need Another Michelangelo: In Italy, Its Robots Turn to Sculpt
description: CARRARA, Italy  For centuries, the massive marble quarries above the Tuscan town of Carrara have yielded the raw material for the polished masterpieces of Italian sculptors like Michelangelo, Canova, Bernini and, most recently, ABB2.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Since the assassination of President Jovenel Mose last week, political chaos has gripped Haiti. On Sunday, the country hurtled toward a constitutional crisis, as its top leaders both jockeyed for control.

title: Extra time: It was never going to be easy.
description: Tweet! Tweeeeeet! Thats it for the first extra period.

title: Voters Chose Boring Over Bombast. They Got Bidens Penchant for Pontificating.
description: CRYSTAL LAKE, Ill.  Even President Biden thought he had been ponderous.

title: Cubans Denounce Misery in Biggest Protests in Decades
description: MIAMI  Shouting Freedom and other anti-government slogans, thousands of Cubans took to the streets in cities around the country on Sunday to protest food and medicine shortages, in a remarkable eruption of discontent not seen in nearly 30 years.

title: We go to penalties at Wembley.
description: Italy is in a tight huddle and England is a looser one as their coaching staff pick their penalty takers. But the tension ahead of the shootout is palpable. All that work, and it comes down to this.

title: Italys Victory at Euro 2020 Echoes a Broader Resurgence
description: ROME  The eruption of sheer joy  and car honking and horn blowing and firework exploding and hugging, so much hugging  across Italy on Sunday after its national mens soccer team defeated England to win the Euro 2020 tournament marked an extraordinary turnaround, not just for a recently beleaguered team, but also for a recently beleaguered country.

title: Short and Stout
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Surprise! Rachel Fabi, your intrepid Monday-to-Wednesday columnist, is off the grid in more ways than one this week, so other members of the growing Wordplay posse will be sitting in for her.

title: Should a Mental Health Emergency Derail a Dangerous Climb?
description: Cory Richards was about to attempt an unclimbed route up the seventh-highest mountain in the world when he realized he needed to stop before he started.

title: 5 Pieces of Good News About the News
description: My great predecessor in this column, David Carr, wrote at a time when the conventional wisdom was that the internet was destroying journalism.

title: Dueling Claims to Power. Broken Institutions. How Does Haiti Fix This?
description: PARIS  Battered by gang violence and corruption, its Parliament near vacant, its judiciary in tatters, its Constitution subject to dispute, its poverty crushing and its history a chronicle of unrest, Haiti was in bad shape even before its president was assassinated and rival factions laid claim to power.

title: Haitians denounce photos said to be of Moses corpse.
description: The photos are horrifying. They seem to portray the body of President Jovenel Mose of Haiti laid out in the morgue, his left eye crushed in, the flesh of one of his arms torn by bullets, his mouth gaping.

title: Despite Outbreaks Among Unvaccinated, Fox News Hosts Smear Shots
description: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: A Day Filled With Noise, and a Silence Theyll Never Forget
description: LONDON  All day, there had been noise. The songs had started early in the morning, as the first few hundred fans appeared on Wembley Way, flags fluttering from their backs. They had echoed through the afternoon, as first tens and then a hundred thousand more had joined them, as shattered glass crunched underfoot.

title: Third Man With U.S. Ties Has Been Arrested in Haiti Assassination
description: The Haitian authorities said Sunday they were holding a Florida-based doctor they believed had aspirations of seizing power in his native country in the assassination of President Jovenel Mose.

title: At Wimbledon, Novak Djokovic Sends a Message Impossible to Ignore
description: WIMBLEDON, England  The Big Three now have 20 apiece.

title: Weapons Cache Seized at Denver Hotel Near Stadium Hosting All-Star Game
description: The police in Denver seized 16 long guns, body armor and more than 1,000 rounds of ammunition on Friday at a hotel about two blocks from the stadium where the Major League Baseball All-Star Game is to be played this week, according to officials and local reports.

title: Bootleg Fire in Oregon Scorches 150,000 Acres as Heat Wave Continues in the West
description: As the West continues to bake under torrid temperatures, an out-of-control wildfire burning across southwest Oregon has scorched more than 150,000 acres, threatening the power grid that connects Oregon and California and driving people from their homes.

title: Haitis police claim a Florida-based doctor recruited mercenaries.
description: A Haitian-born doctor based in Florida has been arrested as a key suspect in the assassination of President Jovenel Mose of Haiti, and the national police chief suggested at a news conference that he believed the suspect was plotting to become president.

title: M.L.B.s Top Prospects Are Busy Again
description: DENVER  When the call came for Spencer Torkelson, he was at home in California, locked down like everyone else. His college baseball season at Arizona State had ended abruptly because of the coronavirus pandemic, so he was free of distractions when the Detroit Tigers selected him first overall in the draft in June 2020.

title: Murder Mystery: What Were Colombian Military Vets Doing in Haiti?
description: BOGOT, Colombia  One evening in early June, Mauricio Javier Romero, a decorated 20-year veteran of the Colombian military, received a call from an old army buddy.

title: Prominent Lawyer in Discussions to Represent Britney Spears
description: A prominent Hollywood lawyer has had discussions in recent days with Britney Spears about representing her in her conservatorship battle, and he plans to attend a hearing in Los Angeles on Wednesday to begin the process of taking over as her counsel, according to a person briefed on the matter.

title: The Voter Fraud Fraud
description: It was March 3, 2020, the day of the Democratic primary in Texas, and Hervis Rogers, a 62-year-old Black man, was intent on making his voice heard at the ballot box. He arrived at the polling place around 7 p.m. and joined the line.

title: Nordstrom, Eyeing 20-Somethings, Strikes Deal With the Online Giant Asos
